intro: Tarlmounia elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tarlmounia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to harsh environments. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes and dry gardens.
